message_1: Consider the statement "It will rain today." Let's define the propositional variable p to represent this statement. Using temporal logic, write an expression for the statement "It will not rain today, but it will rain tomorrow." using p and the logical operators $\neg$ (negation), $\land$ (conjunction), and $\rightarrow$ (implication).
message_2:
Using temporal logic, we can represent the statement "It will not rain today, but it will rain tomorrow" as:

$(\neg p) \land (\bigcirc p)$

Here, $\neg p$ represents "It will not rain today" and $\bigcirc p$ represents "It will rain tomorrow". The $\land$ operator is used to combine these two statements.
